attributes.action: Right to leave a phone contract without penalty due to  price change by provider
attributes.additional_details: Phone contract is a 2-way contract. If the government thinks service providers can change the monthly charge, the subscribers should also have the right to exit the contract without penalty
attributes.background:
Government has allowed phone service providers an annual price rise
adjustment on customers’ monthly subscription charge by no more than the RPI or CPI +3.9%, only once every 12 months.

rejection.details:
Ofcom has banned mid-contract price rises linked to inflation. You can find out more information here:

https://www.ofcom.org.uk/phones-and-broadband/bills-and-charges/ofcom-bans-mid-contract-price-rises-linked-to-inflation
